articles.title: High-severity WinRAR 0-day exploited for weeks by 2 groups
articles.description: Exploits allow for persistent backdooring when targets open booby-trapped archive.
articles.author: Dan Goodin
articles.content: Exploits allow for persistent backdooring when targets open booby-trapped archive.

articles.title: Multiagent AI for generating chain-of-thought training data
articles.description: Using ensembles of agents to generate and refine interactions annotated with chains of thought improves performance on a battery of benchmarks by an average of 29%.
articles.author: Charith Peris
articles.content: Using ensembles of agents to generate and refine interactions annotated with chains of thought improves performance on a battery of benchmarks by an average of 29%.

articles.title: NIH researchers develop AI agent that improves accuracy of gene set analysis by leveraging expert-curated databases
articles.description: The AI agent could help lead to a better understanding of how different diseases and conditions affect groups of genes individually and together.
articles.content: The AI agent could help lead to a better understanding of how different diseases and conditions affect groups of genes individually and together.

articles.title: ChatGPT will apologize for anything
articles.description: ChatGPT will apologize for anything - even advice it definitely didn't give, and stuff it definitely didn't do. It very much regrets its recommendation that we hire a giraffe as CEO.
articles.author: Janelle Shane
articles.content: ChatGPT will apologize for anything - even advice it definitely didn't give, and stuff it definitely didn't do. It very much regrets its recommendation that we hire a giraffe as CEO.

articles.title: GPT OSS models from OpenAI are now available on SageMaker JumpStart
articles.description: Today, we are excited to announce the availability of Open AI’s new open weight GPT OSS models, gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, from OpenAI in Amazon SageMaker JumpStart. With this launch, you can now deploy OpenAI’s newest reasoning models to build, experiment, and responsibly scale your generative AI ideas on AWS. In this post, we demonstrate how to get started with these models on SageMaker JumpStart.
articles.author: Niithiyn Vijeaswaran
articles.content: Today, we are excited to announce the availability of Open AI’s new open weight GPT OSS models, gpt-oss-120b and gpt-oss-20b, from OpenAI in Amazon SageMaker JumpStart. With this launch, you can now deploy OpenAI’s newest reasoning models to build, experiment, and responsibly scale your generative AI ideas on AWS. In this post, we demonstrate how to get started with these models on SageMaker JumpStart.

articles.title: New NIST Reference Material to Strengthen Quality Control for Biological Drugs
articles.description: Impurities in these drugs can cause undesirable immune responses in patients and can significantly drive up costs for drug manufacturers.
articles.author: Sarah Henderson
articles.content: Impurities in these drugs can cause undesirable immune responses in patients and can significantly drive up costs for drug manufacturers.

articles.title: NASA and Google are building an AI medical assistant to keep Mars-bound astronauts healthy
articles.description: The multimodal tool, which includes speech, text, and images, runs inside Google Cloud’s Vertex AI environment.
articles.author: Aria Alamalhodaei
articles.content: The multimodal tool, which includes speech, text, and images, runs inside Google Cloud’s Vertex AI environment.

articles.title: JWST Spots Possible Alien Planet at Alpha Centauri
articles.description: In some of its most ambitious work yet, the James Webb Space Telescope looked to spot a planet in a potentially habitable orbit around Alpha Centauri A, the nearest sunlike star to our solar system
articles.content: In some of its most ambitious work yet, the James Webb Space Telescope looked to spot a planet in a potentially habitable orbit around Alpha Centauri A, the nearest sunlike star to our solar system

articles.title: Smart microscope captures aggregation of misfolded proteins
articles.description: Thematic illustration of smart microscopy for detecting protein aggregation. 2025 Alexey Chizhik/EPFL – CC-BY-SA 4.0. By Celia Luterbacher EPFL researchers have developed a microscope that can be used to predict the onset of misfolded protein aggregation – a hallmark of neurodegenerative disease – as well as analyze the biomechanical properties of these aggregates. articles.title: The Two-Sided Coin of AI-Assisted Coding
articles.description: SoftBank’s recent declaration that the era of human programmers is ending caught my attention, especially the audacious estimate that one thousand AI agents would be needed to replicate the capabilities of a single human developer. As readers of this newsletter and listeners of my podcast will attest, I was an early adopter of AI‑assisted coding—andContinue reading "The Two-Sided Coin of AI-Assisted Coding" The post The Two-Sided Coin of AI-Assisted Coding appeared first on Gradient Flow.

articles.title: Getting Started with Spec-Driven Development Using Kiro + Jules + Cursor + GPT-5
articles.description: OpenAI has finally announced GPT-5. https://openai.com/index/introducing-gpt-5/ As part of the launch, GPT‑5 is available free or at a significantly reduced price for a limited time. Notably, on Cursor, even new users can access GPT‑5 in Agent Mode at no cost. In this article, we’ll take advantage of this window to demonstrate Spec‑Driven Development using near‑free tooling. Components Used While many combinations are possible, for this walkthrough we’ll use tools that offer generous free...

articles.title: The Next Generation of AI Agents: Large Action Models Explained
articles.description: As AI agents become commonplace in enterprise workflows, teams are discovering the limitations of building task-specific automated systems from scratch. Large Action Models (LAMs) represent the foundational layer that transforms how we build agents—providing the general-purpose perception, planning, and execution capabilities that individual agents can leverage rather than reinvent. Instead of building isolated automation tools,Continue reading "The Next Generation of AI Agents: Large Action...
articles.author: Ben Lorica
articles.content: As AI agents become commonplace in enterprise workflows, teams are discovering the limitations of building task-specific automated systems from scratch. Large Action Models (LAMs) represent the foundational layer that transforms how we build agents—providing the general-purpose perception, planning, and execution capabilities that individual agents can leverage rather than reinvent. Instead of building isolated automation tools,Continue reading "The Next Generation of AI Agents: Large Action...

articles.title: Whither symbols in the era of advanced neural networks?
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05776v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Some of the strongest evidence that human minds should be thought about in terms of symbolic systems has been the way they combine ideas, produce novelty, and learn quickly. We argue that modern neural networks -- and the artificial intelligence systems built upon them -- exhibit similar abilities. This undermines the argument that the cognitive processes and representations used by human minds are symbolic, although the fact that these neural...
articles.author: Thomas L. Griffiths, Brenden M. Lake, R. Thomas McCoy, Ellie Pavlick, Taylor W. Webb
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05776v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Some of the strongest evidence that human minds should be thought about in terms of symbolic systems has been the way they combine ideas, produce novelty, and learn quickly. We argue that modern neural networks -- and the artificial intelligence systems built upon them -- exhibit similar abilities. This undermines the argument that the cognitive processes and representations used by human minds are symbolic, although the fact that these neural...

articles.title: An Effective Approach for Node Classification in Textual Graphs
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05836v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Textual Attribute Graphs (TAGs) are critical for modeling complex networks like citation networks, but effective node classification remains challenging due to difficulties in integrating rich semantics from text with structural graph information. Existing methods often struggle with capturing nuanced domain-specific terminology, modeling long-range dependencies, adapting to temporal evolution, and scaling to massive datasets. To address these...
articles.author: Rituparna Datta, Nibir Chandra Mandal
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05836v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Textual Attribute Graphs (TAGs) are critical for modeling complex networks like citation networks, but effective node classification remains challenging due to difficulties in integrating rich semantics from text with structural graph information. Existing methods often struggle with capturing nuanced domain-specific terminology, modeling long-range dependencies, adapting to temporal evolution, and scaling to massive datasets. To address these...

articles.title: LinguaFluid: Language Guided Fluid Control via Semantic Rewards in Reinforcement Learning
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05977v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In the domain of scientific machine learning, designing effective reward functions remains a challenge in reinforcement learning (RL), particularly in environments where task goals are difficult to specify numerically. Reward functions in existing work are predominantly based on heuristics, manual engineering, or task-specific tuning. In this work, we introduce a semantically aligned reinforcement learning method where rewards are computed by...

Reward functions in existing work are predominantly based on heuristics, manual engineering, or task-specific tuning. articles.title: Decorrelated feature importance from local sample weighting
articles.description: arXiv:2508.06337v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Feature importance (FI) statistics provide a prominent and valuable method of insight into the decision process of machine learning (ML) models, but their effectiveness has well-known limitations when correlation is present among the features in the training data. In this case, the FI often tends to be distributed among all features which are in correlation with the response-generating signal features. Even worse, if multiple signal features are...
articles.author: Benedikt Fr\"ohlich, Alison Durst, Merle Behr
articles.content: arXiv:2508.06337v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Feature importance (FI) statistics provide a prominent and valuable method of insight into the decision process of machine learning (ML) models, but their effectiveness has well-known limitations when correlation is present among the features in the training data. In this case, the FI often tends to be distributed among all features which are in correlation with the response-generating signal features. Even worse, if multiple signal features are...

articles.title: Diagrams-to-Dynamics (D2D): Exploring Causal Loop Diagram Leverage Points under Uncertainty
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05659v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Causal loop diagrams (CLDs) are widely used in health and environmental research to represent hypothesized causal structures underlying complex problems. However, as qualitative and static representations, CLDs are limited in their ability to support dynamic analysis and inform intervention strategies. Additionally, quantitative CLD analysis methods like network centrality analysis often lead to false inference. We propose Diagrams-to-Dynamics...
articles.author: Jeroen F. Uleman, Loes Crielaard, Leonie K. Elsenburg, Guido A. Veldhuis, Karien Stronks, Naja Hulvej Rod, Rick Quax, V\'itor V. Vasconcelos
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05659v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Causal loop diagrams (CLDs) are widely used in health and environmental research to represent hypothesized causal structures underlying complex problems. However, as qualitative and static representations, CLDs are limited in their ability to support dynamic analysis and inform intervention strategies. Additionally, quantitative CLD analysis methods like network centrality analysis often lead to false inference. We propose Diagrams-to-Dynamics...

articles.title: InfiGUI-G1: Advancing GUI Grounding with Adaptive Exploration Policy Optimization
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05731v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The emergence of Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) has propelled the development of autonomous agents that operate on Graphical User Interfaces (GUIs) using pure visual input. A fundamental challenge is robustly grounding natural language instructions. This requires a precise spatial alignment, which accurately locates the coordinates of each element, and, more critically, a correct semantic alignment, which matches the instructions to the...

articles.title: MZEN: Multi-Zoom Enhanced NeRF for 3-D Reconstruction with Unknown Camera Poses
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05819v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) methods excel at 3D reconstruction from multiple 2D images, even those taken with unknown camera poses. However, they still miss the fine-detailed structures that matter in industrial inspection, e.g., detecting sub-micron defects on a production line or analyzing chips with Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM). In these scenarios, the sensor resolution is fixed and compute budgets are tight, so the only way to expose...
articles.author: Jong-Ik Park, Carlee Joe-Wong, Gary K. Fedder
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05819v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Neural Radiance Fields (NeRF) methods excel at 3D reconstruction from multiple 2D images, even those taken with unknown camera poses. However, they still miss the fine-detailed structures that matter in industrial inspection, e.g., detecting sub-micron defects on a production line or analyzing chips with Scanning Electron Microscopy (SEM). In these scenarios, the sensor resolution is fixed and compute budgets are tight, so the only way to expose...

articles.title: MAISI-v2: Accelerated 3D High-Resolution Medical Image Synthesis with Rectified Flow and Region-specific Contrastive Loss
articles.description: arXiv:2508.05772v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Medical image synthesis is an important topic for both clinical and research applications. Recently, diffusion models have become a leading approach in this area. Despite their strengths, many existing methods struggle with (1) limited generalizability that only work for specific body regions or voxel spacings, (2) slow inference, which is a common issue for diffusion models, and (3) weak alignment with input conditions, which is a critical issue...
articles.author: Can Zhao, Pengfei Guo, Dong Yang, Yucheng Tang, Yufan He, Benjamin Simon, Mason Belue, Stephanie Harmon, Baris Turkbey, Daguang Xu
articles.content: arXiv:2508.05772v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Medical image synthesis is an important topic for both clinical and research applications. Recently, diffusion models have become a leading approach in this area. Despite their strengths, many existing methods struggle with (1) limited generalizability that only work for specific body regions or voxel spacings, (2) slow inference, which is a common issue for diffusion models, and (3) weak alignment with input conditions, which is a critical issue...
